intro: Manihot gracilis subsp. varians, commonly known as the slender arrowleaf manioc, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often cultivated for its starchy roots, which are used in various culinary applications. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
